channel.title: Do Online Relationships Work?
channel.description: What do you think about online relationships?

item.title: Do Online Relationships Work?
item.dc:creator: @Chrix Chrix
item.description:
@Chrix wrote:

Yes, why yes they do.

My sister and her Fiance have been together for almost 4 years and see each other often, but mail order bride relationships do not work.

Read full topic

item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:150, topic:469117”][quote author=Krackkid link=topic=586184.msg4325009#msg4325009 date=1372743703]
Maybe just maybe its your moms fault? Either she is looking for the wrong guys, lying about stuff, being lied too and falling for it , Or something like that, doesn’t matter online or offline just gotta be your self lol ,my brother met his now wife online and they been together 4years and now have a baby.

[/quote]how do you have a baby online

where is loveandpower[/quote]Well they met online ._. and I think the sims social might help.

item.title: Do Online Relationships Work?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

Porygon:

Yesterday on MTV, there was a “Catfish” marathon. The show is about people who have an online relationship with someone they have never truly met. These relationships range from 6 months to 10 years. The show finally forces them to meet each other, and when they do meet, it’s usually a completely different person than online.

Yeah I love that show hahaha

Read full topic

item.title: Do Online Relationships Work?
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:141, topic:469117”][quote author=Porygon link=topic=586184.msg4321241#msg4321241 date=1372248587]
Yesterday on MTV, there was a “Catfish” marathon. The show is about people who have an online relationship with someone they have never truly met. These relationships range from 6 months to 10 years. The show finally forces them to meet each other, and when they do meet, it’s usually a completely different person than online.
[/quote]it’s a person’s choice to be honest online. but if the aforementioned persons were 100% honest with each other online, the actual confrontation would be nothing but mere joy.

online relationships work (just like regular relationships work) as long as there is trust, honesty, and communication. it’s just up two the two people to play their part and put in effort. regardless of whether it be long distance, online, across the street, or anything. you have to try to make it work. there’s no “yes” or “no” answer to any type of relationship. it’s up to the people to make it work. not up to you to decide[/quote]

This is true

Read full topic

These relationships range from 6 months to 10 years. The show finally forces them to meet each other, and when they do meet, it’s usually a completely different person than online.[/quote]it’s a person’s choice to be honest online. but if the aforementioned persons were 100% honest with each other online, the actual confrontation would be nothing but mere joy.

online relationships work (just like regular relationships work) as long as there is trust, honesty, and communication. it’s just up two the two people to play their part and put in effort. regardless of whether it be long distance, online, across the street, or anything. you have to try to make it work. there’s no “yes” or “no” answer to any type of relationship. it’s up to the people to make it work. not up to you to decide

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Porygon Porygon
item.description:

Again relationship doesn’t work, making it online doesn’t make it any better.

Are you saying all relationships don’t work?
[/quote]

You need to be fully committed from day one to make it work; I learnt the hard way :p[/quote]
No doubt about that.

item.title: Do Online Relationships Work?
item.dc:creator: @Porygon Porygon
item.description:
@Porygon wrote:

Ambokile:

Meeting someone online who is close to you can work. A relationship that never makes it into the real world will be unlikely to work.

Agreed.

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:133, topic:469117”][quote author=Porygon link=topic=586184.msg4320575#msg4320575 date=1372171771]

Again relationship doesn’t work, making it online doesn’t make it any better.

Are you saying all relationships don’t work?
[/quote]
In the long run, yes.[/quote]
How long are you implying?

Read full topic
